The good news? We know what works. We need to tackle the root causes of migration from Central American countries, not merely the symptoms at our border. We must address the violence and humanitarian crisis in the Northern Triangle forcing families to seek refuge in the U.S.

Just yesterday, President Trump declared a national emergency for his manufactured crisis at the U.S. Southern border. But if President Trump wants to actually get serious about addressing migration, then we need long-term and comprehensive solutions.

At a time when immigration and border security talks are heightened, it‚Äôs important to learn more about the places that the migrants arriving at our U.S. Southern border are coming from. And that‚Äôs what we‚Äôre here to do.
